member.summary: This method enables tracking ability to see what parts and roots are created. In order to better support AOT scenarios, an empty package with no knowledge of any parts would be constructed and required parts would be added via additional builders. The debug information gathered with this may be helpful in identifying which parts are required to open packages.

member.returns: Returns true if the first child element was read successfully; false if there are no child elements to read.

member.returns: Returns true if the next sibling element was read successfully; false if there are no more sibling elements to read.
member.remarks: At the current node, the reader will move to the end tag of the parent node if there are no more sibling elements.

member.remarks: The lexical forms of base64Binary values are limited to the 65 characters of the Base64 Alphabet defined in [RFC 2045], i.e., a-z, A-Z, 0-9, the plus sign (+), the forward slash (/) and the equal sign (=), together with the characters defined in [XML 1.0 (Second Edition)] as white space. member.remarks: hexBinary has a lexical representation where each binary octet is encoded as a character tuple, consisting of two hexadecimal digits ([0-9a-fA-F]) representing the octet code. For example, "0FB7" is a hex encoding for the 16-bit integer 4023 (whose binary representation is 111110110111).

member.name: T:DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Validation.Schema.Restrictions.AnyUriRestriction
member.summary: AnyURI (xsd:anyURI) based simple type constraint.
member.remarks: anyURI represents a Uniform Resource Identifier Reference (URI). An anyURI value can be absolute or relative, and may have an optional fragment identifier (i.e., it may be a URI Reference). This type should be used to specify the intention that the value fulfills the role of a URI as defined by [RFC 2396], as amended by [RFC 2732].

member.name: T:DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Validation.Schema.Restrictions.QnameRestriction
member.summary: QName (xsd:QName) based simple type constraint.
member.remarks: QName represents XML qualified names. The value space of QName is the set of tuples {namespace name, local part}, where namespace name is an anyURI and local part is an NCName. The lexical space of QName is the set of strings that match the QName production of [Namespaces in XML].

member.name: T:DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Validation.Schema.Restrictions.TokenRestriction
member.summary: Token (xsd:token) based simple type constraint.
member.remarks:
token represents tokenized strings. The value space of token is the set of strings that do not contain the carriage return (#xD), line feed (#xA) nor tab (#x9) characters, that have no leading or trailing spaces (#x20) and that have no internal sequences of two or more spaces. The lexical space of token is the set of strings that do not contain the carriage return (#xD), line feed (#xA) nor tab (#x9) characters, that have no leading or trailing spaces (#x20) and that have no internal sequences of two or more spaces. The base type of token is normalizedString
In Ecma376, most token are enumerations.

member.name: M:DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Validation.Schema.Restrictions.TokenRestriction.VerifyTOKEN(System.String)
member.summary: An implementation of XmlConvert.VerifyTOKEN(string) as it is not available cross platform and throws if fails
